intro: [WRONG START] Embilia lampani, commonly known as the Malabar embelia, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy berries that are typically red when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in dense forests. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
